revised_title: The Discovery of Thallium and the Context of Spectro-Chemical Analysis
tldr: This article discusses the discovery of thallium by William Crookes and the context in which his work on spectro-chemical analysis took place. It highlights the challenges in defining the discovery of a chemical element and the complex set of factors that influenced Crookes's research. The article also explores the development of spectro-chemical analysis by Robert Bunsen and Gustav Kirchhoff and its impact on the scientific community.
